note.p: Death: River Avon, near Bath, Somerset (15 October 1743)
Education: Pembroke College, Oxford (matriculated 1720); Lincoln's Inn (admitted 1721)

Career: MP for Haverfordwest (1726-death); Trustee of the Georgia Society (1732); travelled to Italy for the sake of his health (1739); drowned on his way home from Bath, after his horse was frightened by some pigs and threw him into the Avon
Proposers: Robert Hucks; William Rutty; James Jurin
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Foster; Sedgwick; GEC Baronetage
